info.title: LDAP subscriber API for carriers and ISPs
info.summary: A Lua-based, lightweight wrapper around OpenLDAP
info.description: This API runs natively in OpenResty/NGINX to provide a high performance restful layer around an LDAP instance.  It should be mostly object agonistic, but has some special endpoints

get.description: Return an array of available realms

requestBody.description: The definition of the new realm

get.description: Get metadata for a realm

put.description: Update realm metadata by replacing all the fields of the current object with the new values

patch.description:
Update realm metdata by replacing only the provided attributes.

Attributes with a null value will be removed.

Multi-valued attributes will have all values replaced

delete.description: Delete a realm.  The prune param must be true if the realm contains subscribers

get.description: Return an array of all subscribers in a realm

requestBody.description: Definition of the subscriber to add

post.summary: Add a subscriber to a realm

get.description: Get specific subscriber for a given realm

put.description: Replace an existing subscriber in a given realm

patch.description:
Update a subscriber in a given realm by replacing only the provided attributes.

Attributes with a null value will be removed.

Multi-valued attributes will have all values replaced

delete.description: Delete a subscriber in a given realm

get.description: Return an array of available subscriber groups

requestBody.description: Definition of the subscriber group to add

get.description: Get a subscriber group definition

put.description: Replace subscriber group metadata.  Will not affect group membership

requestBody.description: Partial definition of a subscriber group

patch.description:
Update a subscriber group's metadata by replacing only the provided attributes.

Attributes with a null value will be removed.

Multi-valued attributes will have all values replaced

get.description: Return an array of available services

requestBody.description: Definition of the service to add

get.description: Get service metadata

patch.description:
Update service metadata by replacing only the provided attributes.

Attributes with a null value will be removed.

Multi-valued attributes will have all values replaced

get.description: Return an array of available serviceProfiles (abstract profiles) for a given service

requestBody.description: Definition of the serviceProfile (abstract profile) to add

post.summary: Add a serviceProfile to a service

get.description: Return a serviceProfile i.e. an abstract profile describing a class of service

patch.description:
Update a serviceProfile by replacing only the provided attributes.

Attributes with a null value will be removed.

Multi-valued attributes will have all values replaced

get.description: Return an array of policies (concrete profiles containing FreeRADIUS attributes) associated with a serviceProfile (an abstract profile)

post.description: Definition of a policy (concrete profile) to add

requestBody.description: Definition of a policy to add

post.summary: Add a freeradiusProfile to a serviceProfile

get.description: Return a freeradiusPolicy (a concrete profile)
get.summary: Return a freeradiusProfile associated with a serviceProfile

patch.description:
Update a freeradiusPolicy by replacing only the provided attributes.

Attributes with a null value will be removed.

Multi-valued attributes will have all values replaced

get.description: Return an array of clients

requestBody.description: Definition of an client to add

get.description: Return an client

patch.description:
Update an client replacing only the provided attributes.

Attributes with a null value will be removed.

Multi-valued attributes will have all values replaced.

get.description: Return an array of ports associated with an client
get.summary: List ports associated with a client

requestBody.description: Definition of an client to add

post.summary: Add a port associated with a client

get.description: Return a port associated with an access deivce
get.summary: Return a port associated with a client

put.summary: Replace a port associated with a client

patch.summary: Update a port associated with a client

get.description: Return an array of clientGroups

requestBody.description: Definition of the clientGroup to add

get.description: Return an clientGroup

put.description: Replace an clientGroup metadata and profiles.  Does not affect group membership

patch.description:
Update an clientGroup replacing only the provided attributes.

Attributes with a null value will be removed.

Multi-valued attributes will have all values replaced

get.description: Return an array of accessDevices

requestBody.description: Definition of an accessDevice to add

get.description: Return an accessDevice

patch.description:
Update an accessDevice replacing only the provided attributes.

Attributes with a null value will be removed.

Multi-valued attributes will have all values replaced.

get.description: Return an array of ports associated with an accessDevice
get.summary: List ports associated with an accessDevice

requestBody.description: Definition of an accessDevice to add

post.summary: Add a port associated with an accessDevice

get.description: Return a port associated with an access deivce
get.summary: Return a port associated with an accessDevice

put.summary: Replace a port associated with an accessDevice

patch.summary: Update a port associated with an accessDevice

delete.summary: Delete a port associated with a client

parameters.name: x-permissions
parameters.description: If true, returns endpoints directly under the current path that the user can access, and their permissions.  Returns "permissionsResponse"

parameters.name: copy_uri
parameters.description: If specified URL is the same resource type as the endpoint called, a copy will be initiated.  The behaviour of the copy depends on the presence of the `copy_recursive` flag, and the HTTP verb used.  `POST` will result in objects being created, `PUT` will replace existing objects, `PATCH` will modify existing objects. `POST` only is allowed to contain a JSON payload, which can be used to alter the ID of the destination object.

parameters.name: copy_recursive
parameters.description: If true, copy the object specified by `copy_uri` and its decedents.

get.description:
This endpoint demonstrates certain operations which apply globally to all endpoints.  
The OpenAPI specification is not flexible enough to represent this.

Global endpoints are triggered by using a specific header or query parameter.

The documentation for those parameters states the response type that'll be received.

realm.title: realm
realm.description: Holds a set of subscriber, and LDAP/RADIUS attributes associated with a given realm

id.description: The realm ID.  This may map directly with the domain portion in a user's NAI, and can be used to separate subscriber belonging to different areas of the business, or to external customers

description.description: A humanly readable description of the realm
description.example: example.org subscriber are actually foo subscriber, who we are authenticating on behalf of bar

servicePrecedence.description: If a subscriber did not authenticate using a qualified NAI, and appears in multiple realm, the first primary realm with take precedence

serviceProfile.description: The URI of a serviceProfile object to apply to all subscriber in this realm.  The serviceProfile object must exist, and referential integrity will be enforced

subscriber.title: subscriber
subscriber.description:
A subscriber - A user authenticating via the RADIUS service.

Note: The attributes listed in the definition of the object are a subset of the attributes available.

Any attribute that's available in the relevant LDAP schema (freeradius-radius.schema, freeradius-dhcpv4.schema, freeradius-dhcpv6.schema, etc...) for the protocol, can be included in POST, PATCH, PUT actions, including generic attributes such as `radiusAttribute`.  Generic attributes take the format `<attribute> <op> <quote><value><quote>` e.g. `Reply-Message := "Welcome user %{User-Name}"`, and can be used to add any attribute allowed in the protocol dictionary.

id.description: Must be set to the combination of subscriberID '+' serviceId.  This uniquely identifies a subscriber object for a particular type of service, e.g. fixedLine vs wireless

subscriberId.description: A unique (within a realm) identifier for a subscriber

serviceStatus.description: Whether this subscriber can access the service

statusReason.description: Why the subscriber's service was disabled or suspended

serviceId.description: The type of access media this subscriber object relates to, e.g. fixedLine, wireless etc... Must match a configured service category

servicePrecedence.description: If multiple subscriber objects match an incoming Access-Request, the first subscriber object with "primary" will be used

serviceProfile.description: The URI of a service profile object to apply to the subscriber

serviceProfileSuspended.description: The URI of a service profile object to apply to the subscriber

clientGroup.description: The URI(s) of a clientGroup to restrict subscriber to.  Prevents subscriber from connecting RADIUS clients outside of this set of groups

subscriberGroup.description: The URI of a subscriberGroup object.  Used to apply common sets of RADIUS attributes or serviceProfiles to subscriber

portBindingclient.description: URI of the last client the subscriber authenticated via.  Primarily used for Change of Authorisation and disconnect messages

portBindingIdentifier.description: The subscriber's unique circuit ID, either learned or pre-provisioned

portBindingModified.description: When port binding details were last updated

portBinding.description: If true, the subscriber will be unabled to authenticate via any other circuit than the one we learned the first time the subscriber authenticated

subscriberGroup.title: subscriberGroup
subscriberGroup.description: A group of subscriber, used to apply RADIUS attribute overrides to subsets of subscriber

id.description: A unique identifier for the subscriberGroup

client.title: client
client.description: An client that is authorized to communicate with the RADIUS service

id.description: An IP address or subnet (cidr format) that uniquely identifies the RADIUS client

freeradiusClientShortname.description: A friendly name that will be shown in logs

freeradiusClientComment.description: A humanly readable comment associated with the client
freeradiusClientComment.example: This RADIUS client authenticates all subscriber in the foo region of bar

radiusClientSecret.description: The shared secret (pre-shared-key) the RADIUS client will use to communicate with the RADIUS service

radiusClientRequireMa.description: Whether we requires the Message-Authenticator attribute in Access-Requests from this client

tacacsClientSecret.description: The shared key the TACACS client will use to communicate with the TACACS service

accessDevice.title: accessDevice
accessDevice.description: An accessDevice known to the RADIUS service.  Identical to clients but cannot communicate directly with the RADIUS service.

id.description: An IP address or subnet (cidr format) that uniquely identifies the RADIUS client

freeradiusaClientShortname.description: A friendly name that will be shown in logs

freeradiusClientComment.description: A humanly readable comment associated with the client
freeradiusClientComment.example: This RADIUS client authenticates all subscriber in the foo region of bar

clientGroup.title: clientGroup
clientGroup.description: A method of binding subscriber to a particular group of RADIUS clients

service.title: service
service.description:
ISPs and carriers often provide multiple services for their subscribers.  In addition to fixed line boardband, ISPs or carriers may provide VoIP, metro wireless or cellular data.

A service object contains one or more serviceProfiles for a given service.  Each serviceProfile describes a different class-of-service a subscriber cam receive.  Common differentiations between serviceProfiles are upload/download speed restrictions, permitted hours of service, and permitted data transfer quotas.

id.description: Globally unique identifier for a service

portBinding.description: The default port binding state for any subscriber which uses this serviceProfile

generateCDR.description: Generate Call Data Records for subscriber which use this subscriberProfile

allowSuspension.description: Allow suspension for subscriber that use this serviceProfile.  If false, subscriber will be entirely disabled

serviceProfile.title: serviceProfile
serviceProfile.description:
An abstract definition of a class-of-service a subscriber would receive.  This object holds non-FreeRADIUS attributes which control how a subscriber is authorized/authenticated, and enables/disables additional logic that runs as the subscriber's request is processed.

This object contains multiple freeradiusPolicy objects (as children) which are the concrete implementation of the serviceProfile.  These freeradiusPolicy objects are indexed by clientGroup and describe how to implement a given serviceProfile for a type of client.

portBinding.description: The default port binding state for any subscriber which uses this serviceProfile

generateCDR.description: Generate Call Data Records for subscriber which use this subscriber-profile

allowSuspension.description: Allow suspension for subscriber that use this serviceProfile.  If false, subscriber will be entirely disabled

freeradusPolicy.title: freeradiusPolicy
freeradusPolicy.description:
A set of FreeRADIUS attributes and assigment rules which modify attributes in the current request.  A freeradiusPolicy is can be a "concrete" implementation of a serviceProfile.  freeradiusPolicies may also be assigned to individual subscribers or subscriberGroups.

Note: The attributes listed in the definition of the object are a subset of the attributes available.

Any attribute that's available in the relevant LDAP schema (freeradius-radius.schema, freeradius-dhcpv4.schema, freeradius-dhcpv6.schema, etc...) for the protocol, can be included in POST, PATCH, PUT actions, including generic attributes such as `radiusAttribute`.  Generic attributes take the format `<attribute> <op> <quote><value><quote>` e.g. `Reply-Message := "Welcome user %{User-Name}"`, and can be used to add any attribute allowed in the protocol dictionary.

portQinQ.title: portQinQ
portQinQ.description: A representation of a QinQ SVLAN/CVLAN virtual port

remoteAssociation.description: A reference to a client, accessDevice, or subscriber, that exchanges traffic with the specified cvlan and svlan

portPhysical.title: portPhysical
portPhysical.description: A representation of a QinQ SVLAN/CVLAN virtual port

remoteAssociation.description: A reference to an accessDevice, client or subscriber, that this port connects to.

portPhysStag.title: portPhysStag
portPhysStag.description: A combination of a physical port identifier and QinQ Stag value

remoteAssociation.description: A reference to an accessDevice, client or subscriber, that this port connects to.

serviceId.name: serviceId
serviceId.description: Identifier for a service profile category (maps to a service)

clientId.name: clientId
clientId.description: Unique identifier for a client (an IPv4/v6 address or prefix)

clientGroupId.name: clientGroupId
clientGroupId.description: Identifier for a concrete class of service profile

compoundSubscriberId.name: compoundSubscriberId
compoundSubscriberId.description: A combination of the subscriber's unique id and the service the account relates to

profileId.name: profileId
profileId.description: Identifier for an abstract class of service profile

subscriberGroupId.name: subscriberGroupId
subscriberGroupId.description: Identifier for a group of subscribers

prune.name: prune
prune.description: If true, delete any child objects, e.g. all the subscriber in a realm

accessDeviceId.name: accessDeviceId
accessDeviceId.description: Unique identifier for a an accessDevice

portId.name: portId
portId.description: Unique identifier for a port, within a client or accessDevice

policyId.name: policyId
policyId.description: Identifier for an concrete class of service profile

onCreate.description: Response on creating a new object

Location.description: The URI of the resource that was just created

onInternalServerError.description: An internal error has occurred while talking to one of the backend (LDAP or Postgres). For instance, an attribute was missing when creating an object

error_msg.description: Raw error string from the service element which experienced the error

onSuccess.description: Response sent on a successful operation which did not create an object

onConflict.description: The requested operation conflicts with an existing resource (for instance, trying to create a duplicate resource) or you are trying to delete a node that has children

onNotAllowed.description: The requested operation is not allowed for the given resource

onBadRequest.description:
Can be any of the following:
- The requested path doesnt correspond to the schema.
- Missing or invalid data for POST or PUT operations. Data should always be valid JSON.
- If data contains URL to another resource, the host part of the URL must be identical to the host data being created/modified.

permissionsResponse.description:
This response shows permisssions for children of this endpoint.  

It only shows permissions for namespaces, i.e. fixed objects, it does not show permissions for
user created objects.  Permissions should be assumed to apply to all user created objects beneath
the returned endpoint.

AccessToken.description: Bearer access token used to call API.

tags.name: Abstract profile (serviceProfile)
tags.description: Endpoints for managing service definitions, i.e. speed tiers or bandwidth caps.

tags.name: accessDevice
tags.description: Endpoints for managing accessDevices.  Network elements with policies associated that do not communicate directly with the RADIUS service.

tags.name: Client group
tags.description: Endpoints for managing groups or categories of client.

tags.name: Client
tags.description: Endpoints for managing clients.  Network elements that communicate directly with the service.

tags.name: Concrete profile (freeradiusProfile)
tags.description: Endpoints for managing concrete profiles, i.e. sets of attributes which will be returned to the NAS.

tags.name: Realm
tags.description: Endpoints for managing realms.  Groups of subscribers based on virtual service.

tags.name: Service
tags.description: Endpoints for managing broad categories of service, i.e. 'GPON', 'Wireless802.11', ADSL...

tags.name: Subscriber group
tags.description: Endpoints for managing groups of subscribers.
